title: Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect
OB: When cancelling the process of adding an exception breakpoint, the progress dialog closes immediately. Eventually, the exception list comes up, ignoring the cancellation request. This behavior is incorrect. The cancellation request should be honored, or alternatively, the cancel button should be disabled during the process. This can be achieved by passing false for the 'cancellable' parameter when calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1) Go to the breakpoints pane in the debug perspective
2) Click the '+' button to add an exception breakpoint
3) In the progress dialog, click the 'Cancel' button.
